Text.Text: Who's there?!  Are you friend or foe?!  Speak up, damn your eyes, or you'll get a hammer in your skull!
Who's there?!  Are you friend or foe?!  Speak up, damn your eyes, or you'll get a hammer in your skull!

Eh?  The Ten-Towns, you say?  Hmm - been seeing and hearing too much slithering for my own good these past few days, and I'm jumping at shadows - say, you're an odd-looking one, friend - strange skin, you have, strange indeed.
Hells no, just took me by surprise is all... hold a moment, you aren't those sell-swords from Easthaven I've been hearing about, are you?
It very well *is* my damnable concern.  If I could make you out clearly, I'd give you the what-for, I w... hold a moment, you aren't those sell-swords from Easthaven I've been hearing about, are you?

Eh?  The Ten-Towns, you say?  Hmm - been seeing and hearing too much slithering for my own good these past few days, and I'm jumping at everything... hold a minute, are you the sell-swords from Easthaven I've been hearing about?

Aye, well, Targos, that's what I meant.  Name's Conlan - I run the smithy here - well, my *son* does, but - ah, hells, the boy's gone on a run through Kuldahar, and I think the damn snakes have gotten him.  If they've harmed him-

Heh-heh - you've chosen a fine time to be enjoying Kuldahar's shade, you have.  The snakes have decided to slither down here from the Dragon's Eye and lay siege to Kuldahar - they're tearing at the roots of the Great Tree, trying to force Iselore away from the Heartstone Gem.

Tymora's eyes, at least we evacuated most of the town before the snakes struck - but I doubt we're going to make it out.  Doomed, we are, but I'm not going to leave until I put a few of those damned snakes in the earth, hells no!

Aye, my boy Sheemish went up to Orrick's Tower to try and see if he could dig up any old magic that fool mage had lying around to help defend the town - but it's been almost a day and a night, and no word from him.  I think the damned snakes have gotten him.  If they've harmed him, by the hells, I'll-!

If you could find him, I'd be thankful - Sheemish is my only son, and he's already suffered enough at the hands of those snakes - perhaps I could shave a few coins off of the wares I have here in exchange for your help?  How's that sound?

He's - dead...?  By the Gods, I thought he'd had enough of the evil of the world when the yuan-ti seized the poor boy when he was just a lad - I *never* should have let him go... by the hells, what a *fool* I've been!
Ah, leave me in peace, I've no more words left in me - poor Sheemish... me poor son.

You *found* him, and he's safe?!  Blessed be, you've set my heart at ease, you have.  I thought he'd been kidnapped again, he had - the yuan-ti seized the poor boy when he was just a lad so many years ago, and I never wanted him to go through that again.
Look, I can't offer you much, but I'll be more than glad to shave a few gold off my goods here, if you're interested in buying - and you'd be the only buyers we've had in a long time.

Aye, these weapons would earn us a dragon's horde if we could actually *sell* them down south - did you know they used to be naught but earth-grade iron?  Nay, it's true!  Then, not less than a tenday ago, Sheemish and I were awoken by this strange greenish glow emanating from them - it was like each one was a torch, they were so bright!

Aye, they started beating like a *heart* - like the Heartstone Gem itself!  The stone's done something, to them, it has, made them powerfully strong.  I don't know how, but they'll cleave a horde of snakemen in two - hmmph.  If I could only *see* well enough to aim.  And if I had my old strength back...

There may have been a time I would flee Kuldahar, but not *this* day, I won't.  This isn't the first time those snakes have tortured this town, and I've damn well had enough!  I won't run from them, never again.

Aye, it has.  Those filthy snakemen attacked Kuldahar years ago, kidnapped my son, Sheemish, and terrorized the town - almost drove me away, but then a force from Targos arrived to make a stand against them.  Taught them a lesson, they did.
Targos?  Well, no - I mean Easthaven.  *One* of the Ten-Towns, I think.  Maybe Lonelywood - weren't they in need of help, too?  Pah, my skull's gone soft, there's no use in remembering.
You'd best be who I think you are, or you'll be wearing my hammer between your eyes, you will!

Orrick the Gray, the White, the Black, or somesuch.  Used to be a wizard holed up in the tower to the northwest, kept some dirty sniveling goblin as a servant - never trusted him, I didn't.  His goblin, neither.

Happened to him?  Nothing *happened* to him - he just vanished, years ago - not a word to anyone, just left his tower to fall apart.  It took us months to realize he was gone, and we all thought he might come back, so we left his tower alone.
Then, when the yuan-ti struck, my boy Sheemish figured that there might be something in Orrick's Tower that could be used to drive off the yuan-ti - and there you are.
Hells if I know - or care.  Who's to say where that wizard's path leads?  He cared nothing for us while he dwelled beneath the Great Oak, and I'm glad he's gone.
Gerbash - that dwarven innkeeper?  Gond's fire, no, I haven't seen him - wasn't he was at the watchtower in the Pass?  You should try there.

Well, I sure as the hells haven't seen him.  Sheemish and I heard a commotion off to the east a day or two ago, though - perhaps Gerbash got himself into some trouble with the yuan-ti?  If so, I would follow the trail of dead bodies.

He should be by the Heartstone Gem.  Just head southeast and look for the green glow.  He's half-elf, from way down south, near Deepingdale, I believe he said - eh, but a word of warning before you seek him out.
No, no, not at all - as far as I'm concerned, half-elf's a better sight than most normal folks around here.  But that's not what I meant, no.
Iselore may be stern at times, but with the attacks recently, he's been staying near the Heartstone Gem a great deal - it, eh, helps him defend the town.  The thing is...

When Iselore starts to fight - and Gond's fire, does he *fight* - the gem seems to almost possess him, looking through his eyes.  If he's fighting yuan-ti or anything else, don't hope to even have a chance to have him hear you; he'll be as deaf and blind as me until the Heartstone and the Great Oak are safe.
Gond's *fire,* it's good to feel the warmth of the Great Tree and the grass beneath my feet again - and to be able to enjoy it with your company, friend.  Something you need?
I'm <CHARNAME>.  We've come from the Ten-Towns to help stop the Legion of the Chimera.
We are allies from the Ten-Towns - we've come to help.
Brave words, but the fear in your voice betrays you, old man.  Do not threaten us - we come from the Ten-Towns, not from the camp of your enemies.
I'm <CHARNAME>.  We've come from the Ten-Towns to help stop the Legion of the Chimera.
We are allies from the Ten-Towns - we've come to help.
Brave words, but the fear in your voice betrays you, old man.  Do not threaten us - we come from the Ten-Towns, not from the camp of your enemies.
I'm a drow.  I hope that's not a problem for you.
Yes, I'm a gray dwarf.  I hope that's not a problem for you.
I'm svirneblin - a deep gnome.  Is that a problem?
I know - I had to fight my way through a legion of goblin painters to get here.  I'm a little ashamed about it, actually - does the color clash with my boots?
I have some of the Lower Planes running through my blood.  I hope that's not a problem for you.
Yes, I'm a gold dwarf.  Do you have a problem with that?
My skin is none of your concern, old man.
No, we hail from Targos.
We're mercenaries, yes... but not from Easthaven.
No, we hail from Targos.
We're mercenaries, yes... but not from Easthaven.
No, we hail from Targos.
We're mercenaries, yes... but not from Easthaven.
On a run through Kuldahar?  What do you mean?
What's going on here?
Wait... your son's name isn't Sheemish, is it?
What about your son again?
You mentioned your son had gone on a "run" through Kuldahar - what do you mean?
Well, I'm afraid your son didn't make it.  He suffered... an accident of sorts.  Searching abandoned mage towers is a task best left to bloodthirsty mercenaries.
We've encountered your son - he's fine, but there proved to be more in Orrick's stash than he thought.  He's still searching the place.
Your son has been busy digging through the remains of the wizard's tower - he is no danger unless he sets off a stray warning glyph or two, which would serve him right.
Orrick?
I could try to find him, if you want.  If the yuan-ti have captured him, he can't be far away.
If he stepped outside, then chances are he's dead, old man.  He was a fool to do so with the yuan-ti so thick about the tree - should I see him, I will tell him to return at once.
Well, I'm afraid your son didn't make it.  He suffered... an accident of sorts.  Searching abandoned mage towers is a task best left to bloodthirsty mercenaries.
We've encountered your son - he's fine, but there proved to be more in Orrick's stash than he thought.  He's still searching the place.
Your son has been busy digging through the remains of the wizard's tower - he is no danger unless he sets off a stray warning glyph or two, which would serve him right.
You have goods for sale?  I'd be interested in seeing them.
You have goods for sale?  I'd be interested in seeing them.
Perhaps we'll take you up on your offer - before we do, you mentioned something about Orrick's Tower.  Who's Orrick?
We're looking for someone named Gerbash - have you seen him?
Do you know where Iselore is?
That sounds fair.  But first, what are you doing here?
We'll see if we can find your son, then.  Farewell.
Glad we could help.
Well, if the fool stays within the tower, he should be safe.
You have goods for sale?  I'd be interested in seeing them.
You have goods for sale?  I'd be interested in seeing them.
Perhaps we'll take you up on your offer - before we do, you mentioned something about Orrick's Tower.  Who's Orrick?
We're looking for someone named Gerbash - have you seen him?
Do you know where Iselore is?
What are you doing here?
Perhaps we will return, then.  Farewell.
A glow?
Spare me the rambling, old man, and just show me the weapons.
Never mind - I'll see your goods at some other time.  Farewell.
Before we see your weapons, we're looking for someone named Gerbash - have you seen him?
We found your son, but he had... an accident of sorts.  Searching abandoned mage towers is a task best left to bloodthirsty mercenaries.
We've encountered your son - he's fine, but there proved to be more in Orrick's stash than he thought.  He's still searching the place.
Your son has been busy digging through the remains of the wizard's tower - he is no danger unless he sets off a stray warning glyph or two, which would serve him right.
A question first - you mentioned something about Orrick's Tower.  Who's Orrick?
Perhaps we'll buy some of these items.  Before we do, can you tell us where we can find Iselore?
I'd like to see these enchanted weapons.
Spare me the rambling, old man, and just show me the weapons.
Never mind - I'll see your goods at some other time.  Farewell.
This has happened before?
We found your son, but he had... an accident of sorts.  Searching abandoned mage towers is a task best left to bloodthirsty mercenaries.
We've encountered your son - he's fine, but there proved to be more in Orrick's stash than he thought.  He's still searching the place.

Can you tell us where we can find Iselore?
I'd be interested in seeing the wares you mentioned.
I'd be interested in seeing your wares.
Spare me the rambling, old man, and just show me the weapons.
I see.  Farewell.
A force from Targos?

Can you tell us where we can find Iselore?
I'd be interested in seeing the wares you mentioned.
I'd be interested in seeing your wares.
Spare me the rambling, old man, and just show me the weapons.
Perhaps I'll return later.  Farewell.
It's us, Conlan - but we have bad news.  We found your son, but he had... an accident of sorts.  Searching abandoned mage towers is a task best left to bloodthirsty mercenaries.
We've returned, Conlan - please, lower your hammer.  We've found your son, Sheemish.  He's fine, but there proved to be more in Orrick's stash than he thought.  He's still searching the place.
We found your idiot son - he's been busy digging through the remains of the wizard's tower - he is no danger unless he sets off a stray warning glyph or two, which would serve him right.
We've returned, Conlan - please, lower your hammer.  You mentioned your son had gone on a "run" through Kuldahar - what do you mean?
Calm down.  We're looking for someone named Gerbash - have you seen him?
Before you mentioned something about Orrick's Tower.  Who's Orrick?
Can you tell us where we can find Iselore?
Why did you stay behind, Conlan?  Most of the villagers have left.
We've come for supplies.  Can you help us?
I'd be interested in seeing your wares.
Spare me your threats, old man, and show me your goods.
Just checking on you, Conlan.  Farewell.
What happened to him?
We found your son, but he had... an accident of sorts.  Searching abandoned mage towers is a task best left to bloodthirsty mercenaries.
We've encountered your son - he's fine, but there proved to be more in Orrick's stash than he thought.  He's still searching the place.
Your son has been busy digging through the remains of the wizard's tower - he is no danger unless he sets off a stray warning glyph or two, which would serve him right.

I see.  Farewell.

I see.  Farewell.
He left the watchtower and was headed for Kuldahar - but we don't know if he arrived or not.
We already *came* from the watchtower, old man - last word of him was that he had come here.
We found your son, but he had... an accident of sorts.  Searching abandoned mage towers is a task best left to bloodthirsty mercenaries.
We've encountered your son - he's fine, but there proved to be more in Orrick's stash than he thought.  He's still searching the place.

I'd be interested in seeing the wares you mentioned.
I'd be interested in seeing your wares.
Spare me the rambling, old man, and just show me your weapons.
Hmmm.  We'll keep that in mind.  Farewell.
I certainly hope you don't have anything against half-elves.
A warning?
Is there something wrong with Iselore?
Yes?
Spit it out, old man.  You're trying my patience.
We found your son, but he had... an accident of sorts.  Searching abandoned mage towers is a task best left to bloodthirsty mercenaries.
We've encountered your son - he's fine, but there proved to be more in Orrick's stash than he thought.  He's still searching the place.
